name: Salesforce Tower
snippet: The new tallest building in San Francisco. Construction began in 2014. The architect is Cesar Pelli. Developed by Hines.

name: Transbay Transit Center
snippet: The Grand Central Station of the West. Bus terminal, park, retail, and future Caltrain tracks and California High Speed Rail.

name: 45 Lansing
snippet: New Rincon Hill residential by Crescent Heights and architects HKS.

name: 333 Fremont
snippet: New Rincon Hill residential by Crescent Heights and architects HKS.

name: Herman Cruise Terminal
snippet: A new cruise terminal for San Francisco on Pier 27.

name: Bay Bridge
snippet: After a decade of construction, the new East span of the Bay Bridge is complete.

name: Warriors Arena
snippet: A new basketball arena for the Golden State Warriors.

name: NEMA
snippet: One of the early to finish residential buildings in the newly revitalized Mid-Market neighborhood.

name: Goodwill Tower
snippet: Goodwill on Van Ness and Mission St has been sold. Renders and more details to come. Height and completion are placeholders.

name: 500 Folsom
snippet: Reshaping Folsom street from light industry into a pedestrian corridor.

name: 1400 Mission
snippet: New Rincon Hill residential by Crescent Heights and architects HKS.

name: Central Subway
snippet: Four new subway stops running North to South connecting Chinatown, Union Square, SoMa, and the Caltrain station.

name: 1415 Mission
snippet: New Rincon Hill residential by Crescent Heights and architects HKS.

name: 555 California
snippet: The second tallest building in San Francisco.

name: 101 Polk
snippet: New Rincon Hill residential by Crescent Heights and architects HKS.

name: Transamerica Pyramid
snippet: San Francisco's long reigning tallest building.

name: One Van Ness
snippet: Mid-Market luxury residential building. While still just a proposal, this may succeed in filling in surface parking with much needed new housing.

name: 100 Van Ness
snippet: A renovation of the old AAA building. The entire concrete facade was removed and replaced with clear glass.

name: Onyx
snippet: Residential in the Mission.

name: AVA
snippet: Avalon Bay developed this apartment building at 9th and Mission. Targeted at a young tech crowd.

name: 535 Mission
snippet: New luxury office space going up fast on Mission st near the Transbay Terminal.

name: 222 Second
snippet: LinkedIn bought this building in early 2014. Expect first occupancy to come in late 2015 or early 2016.

name: 8 Octavia
snippet: A gorgeous Saitowitz design which unveils itself coming off of the 101 highway exit onto Octavia.

name: SF Museum of Modern Art
snippet: A modern art museum for the modern age. Eight floors of contemporary art will be displayed. The architect is the Norwegian firm Sn√∏hetta.

name: Trinity Place III
snippet: The third of four phases of the massive Trinity Place development at 8th and Market. This will contribute greatly to the remaking of Mid-Market.

name: Linea
snippet: The new tallest building in San Francisco. Construction began in 2014.

name: Mosso SF
snippet: Two separate rental buildings united by shared amenities and concierge services.

name: 2001 Market/38 Dolores
snippet: Dozens of new apartments with a Whole Foods at the base.

name: 350 Mission
snippet: Salesforce purchased this tower, which is across from their future headquarters at the Salesforce Tower. Expect a speedy finish.

name: Hampton Inn
snippet: Sorely needed budget/family hotel space near the Moscone Conference Center.

name: Moscone Expansion
snippet: More square footage for San Francisco's most important conference space. Decisions on final plans have yet to be made, massive changes are very possible.

name: Market Street Place
snippet: An upscale shopping complex that will expand San Francisco's commercial district up Market street by a city block.

name: 950 Market
snippet: A massive new project by European starchitects BIG. Residential, art space, and hotel in one.

name: Lumina
snippet: New luxury residential units coming to SoMa.

name: 181 Fremont
snippet: Residential at the top, office for the bottom, with a base of retail. Soon to be the second tallest in San Francisco.
